subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit 4 restructuring -- assertThat(..., Constraint)
msgSnippet: ... I m intrigued and confused.  Infused?  Contrigued?  That s it, contrigued. If I write this, how far am I from Astel s ideas? @RunWith(Behavior.class)
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> I have been working with Dave Astels very loosely on the question of how
> the vocabulary of testing affects the way we write programs. He wants to
> see what happens if we remove the vocabulary of testing, hence his
> "Behavior-Driven Development". I don't like the name, but I don't have a
> better alternative, so I'm living with it. Dave has started with RSpec
> (for Ruby) which feels a lot like xUnit, but doesn't use the language of
> testing. I have just started working towards JSpec, using Joe Walnes'
> brilliant observation as a springboard.

I'm intrigued and confused. Infused? Contrigued? That's it, contrigued.

If I write this, how far am I from Astel's ideas?

@RunWith(Behavior.class)
public class LoginBehavior {
@Story public void shouldAllowCorrectLoginToEnter()

@Story public void shouldForbidIncorrectLoginFromEntering()

@Story public void shouldShutDownAccountAfterThreeUnsuccessfulTries()
}

These days, I would write:

public class LoginHandlesCommonCases {
@Test public void allowsCorrectLoginToEnter()

@Test public void forbidsIncorrectLoginFromEntering()

@Test public void shutsDownAccountAfterThreeUnsuccessfulTries()
}

(Side note: interestingly, @Before and @BeforeClass still make sense for
@Story's, but @BeforeTest and @BeforeSuite are clumsier in that context.)

David Saff
